author: BillyONeal
body:
In the following test I cloned LLVM twice, and measured how long it took to delete that repository with cmd's `rmdir /s /q` and pwsh's `Remove-Item -Recurse -Force`. cmd took ~4 seconds and pwsh took ~7.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1544943/82937886-c7b04800-9f45-11ea-9053-f01267a25973.png)

This is on a Ryzen Threadripper 3970X system (32c/64t), and the target disk is an Intel Optane SSD 900P. Both pwsh and cmd are limited by single threaded performance in this test (the SSD is nowhere near breaking a sweat and cmd or pwsh are constantly at ~5% CPU which is one core)
title: Removing a large tree with Remove-Item takes ~50% longer than cmd
